properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR out 10 nm
properties.headline: Gale Watch issued January 9 at 3:48AM PST until January 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Small Craft Advisory, seas around 9 feet at 12
seconds. For the Gale Watch, southwest winds 25 to 35 kt with
gusts up to 45 kt and seas 10 to 13 feet at 10 seconds
possible. For the Hazardous Seas Watch, very steep and
hazardous seas 20 to 25 feet at 16 seconds possible.

* WHERE...All areas for this morning's advisory. The Gale Watch is
for areas between 1 and 30 NM of the coast. The Hazardous Seas
Watch is for all areas.

* WHEN...For the Small Craft Advisory, until 10 AM PST this
morning. For the Gale Watch, from Friday morning through
Friday evening. For the Hazardous Seas Watch, from Friday
evening through Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...In the advisory area small boats and inexperienced
mariners could encounter conditions that could jeopardize
safety. During the watch period, strong winds and very steep
seas could damage or displace fishing gear. Very steep and
hazardous seas could capsize or damage vessels. Bar crossing
will become especially treacherous.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
A Small Craft Advisory means that winds and seas will create a
potential hazard to smaller vessels and inexperienced mariners.

A Gale Watch is issued when the risk of gale force winds of 34 to
47 knots has significantly increased, but the specific timing
and/or location is still uncertain. It is intended to provide
additional lead time for mariners who may wish to consider
altering their plans.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...GALE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
